CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the ORG on ORG and Compensation of Properties ( GPE i GPE dhe PERSON ) ( “ the Commission ” ) decided to recognise the applicant ’s inherited property title to CARDINAL plots of land measuring CARDINAL sq . m and restore them to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the Korça Regional Company for ORG ( GPE zonale e shpërndarjes së energjisë elektrike ) ( “ the defendant ” ) started the construction of a high - voltage line on the applicant ’s plots of lands .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant sought an injunction to suspend the construction works .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) issued an injunction and ordered the construction to be suspended . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the ORG ( “ the Court of Appeal ” ) and ORG respectively upheld that decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action against the defendant to bring the construction works to an end immediately , remove the high - voltage line and restore the site to its previous state .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff in the case discontinued enforcement proceedings concerning the decision of CARDINAL DATE on the grounds that the works had been suspended .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the immediate termination of the works on the applicant ’s plot of land , the removal of the high - voltage line and the restoration of the site to its former state ( ndalimin e punimeve si dhe duke detyruar ana e paditur të heqë kabllot , të dy linjat dhe ta kthejë pronën në gjendjen e mëparshme ) . ORG reasoned that the defendant had unlawfully constructed that line on the applicant ’s property .
On DATE ORG upheld that judgment . On an unspecified date the defendant lodged an appeal with ORG against the lower courts’ judgments .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested that the bailiff enforce the judgment of DATE , as upheld by ORG on DATE . However , as the proceedings on the merits of the case were pending before ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , on DATE ORG provisionally decided to stay the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , the applicant lodged a constitutional appeal against ORG decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal on the grounds that an examination of the applicant ’s action on the merits was pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld in a final judgment ORG judgment of DATE and ORG judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following ORG judgment of DATE , the applicant again requested that the bailiff enforce the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE to DATE the bailiff unsuccessfully sought to enforce the final judgment . In particular , on DATE the bailiff sought to have the defendant comply voluntarily with the judgment . The bailiff further imposed a fine of CARDINAL NORP leks ( ALL ) on the defendant .
On DATE the bailiff again ordered the defendant to pay a fine for failing to comply with the final judgment .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the defendant informed the bailiff that the applicant was prepared to solve the dispute with the authorities by way of a friendly settlement .
On DATE the applicant informed the bailiff that the defendant had failed to reach a settlement with her . She requested the continuation of the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff imposed another fine on the defendant for failing to comply with the final judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a criminal complaint against the bailiff and ORG ( PERSON i PERSON ) ( “ ORG ” ) for failure to comply with the judgment of DATE . It appears that on an unspecified date ORG discontinued the proceedings by virtue of a final judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a criminal complaint against ORG ( ORG ) ( “ AEC ” ) and the PERSON municipality for “ destruction of private property ” . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office discontinued the criminal proceedings in a final decision .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant brought a civil action against C.E.Z Shpërndarje sh.a , which had privatised ORG , claiming damages and loss of profit .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to stay the proceedings and await the conclusion of the civil proceedings instituted by ORG against the administrative decisions of DATE and DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , which had recognised the applicant ’s property rights .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG amended that decision and decided that the proceedings could continue . It appears that the case is still pending before the domestic courts .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG brought a civil action against the applicant to annul the administrative decisions of DATE and DATE on the grounds that the plots of land had belonged to and had been used by ORG since DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the freezing of the title to the applicant ’s plots of land ( vendim për marrjen e masës së sigurimit të padisë duke bllokuar pronën në PERSON ) . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG and ORG lifted the freezing order .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided , at the applicant ’s request , to stay the proceedings and await the conclusion of other civil and criminal proceedings instituted by the applicant . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG and ORG respectively upheld that decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued its examination of the case on the grounds that ORG had failed to attend a hearing without good reason . It would appear that ORG did not appeal against that judgment and it became final on an unspecified date .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL other occasions ORG and ORG brought civil actions against the applicant to annul the administrative decisions of DATE and DATE . On DATE and DATE , respectively , ORG discontinued its examination of the actions on the grounds that ORG and ORG had failed to attend hearings for no good reason . It appears that they did not appeal against either judgment and they became final on an unspecified date .
